name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Strasbourg

reviews.title: Ok but not wonderful
reviews.text: Just stayed here for three nights. Hotel is ok, but its in a very noisy location and you are often disturbed if you want an early night. Staff are friendly and helpful, but the hotel is a basic no frills style.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a lovely weekend in Geneva staying at the Best Western Strasbourg, I am unsure about the bad reviews as we had a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Great Stay at the Strasbourg

reviews.text: Our worst thing about this hotel were the directions from the Train Station, it is ok, we found it, but they were not very clear. If you are coming from the Train Station, to find this hotel, exit the station at the main entrance/exit lake side, standing with your back to entrance/exit look across to road beyond the tram stops and directly in front of you is a row of restaurants, bars etc - Look to your left and on the corner, you will see a large restaurant called Les Brasseurs, head towards this, as you approach you will see a road running down the side of the restaurant, go down this road and then take the first right, you will see the Hotel straight away.
reviews.title: Terrible - try to avoid

reviews.text: The Hotel itself is quite small but it is very comfortable, the staff are nothing but pleasent and friendly and helped us with everything we needed. The room itself was on the small side, but staying for only two nights, were did not spend too much time in there as we wanted to see all the sites. We found the bed comfy - well we slept very well anyway. The breakfast in the morning was adequate, a choice of cereal, breads, Jam, cheese, ham etc etc - everything you would expect for a small hotel offereing a continental breakfast not a 5 star all inclusive in Mexico.
reviews.title: Falls below average

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, you really can not go too wrong, a couple of mins to the train station, tram stops, bus stops etc. Turning left out of the Hotel, this takes you to a Starbucks and to a little shopping area and then into the Metro Shopping centre. Right opposite the hotel is the Les Brasseurs as mentioned above. The back entrance is directly opp the hotel, and this is a good place to eat - I am sure there are many others but I admit we ate here both nights. There are plenty of pubs/bars too, The Britannia, Lord Jim were very good for us English and made us feel very welcome, there are plenty of others but we tended to head back to these bars. There is also a small supermarket if you turn right out the hotel and right again, its just along there.
reviews.title: Appropriate for a short stay

reviews.text: A good location near to the main Cornavin rail station. I stayed in one of the "new" rooms, which although small was renovated to a good standard. The biggest problem was the lack of a/c which meant a hot and stuffy room with the only relief coming from opening the windows wide, but which in turn meant no sleep owing to the noisy comings and goings from the car park which my room overlooked. I guess my rating might be higher had the weather been cold.
reviews.title: Small rooms; too hot

reviews.text: Other facilities were also a bit sparse: no tea/coffee; limited English language TV channels; no stationery. The hotel information book I eventually found hidden in the drawer did tell me that a fan could be borrowed from reception which made the last two nights reasonably bearable. Didn`t eat breakfast so can`t comment. Staff friendly enough. The lift just about fits one human and one suitcase.
reviews.title: Quick Dash to Geneva

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was off to Geneva and just landed there in the afternoon, its proximity to the Cornavin station made check in to the hotel.....rooms are average.....bathroom is very small ( more of a compact types)....worst was that they don't have AC....and the day I check in it was more than 26C....the hotel tried to help me with the Fan. The services was average.
reviews.title: Good location for one night stay - hotel needs a refurbishment

reviews.text: Hotel Strasbourg is located nearby central railway station, so I'ts very easy to find. Inside you see the reality: hotel is getting a bit old. It has a 80's feeling, narrow corridors and there is a lack of climate control. Breakfast was average.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If fit our travelling purpose for one night in June 2013 - but for a longer stay in Geneva I´d consider another place.
reviews.title: Nice city hotel close to city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at this hotel. It is centrally situated and an easy walk even with luggage, from the Station and bus depot. Rooms are compact but in old buildings in Europe this is not unusual. The ensuite was a comfortable size and showers hot and efficient. Our room faced onto a central carpark area on the side of the building and was quiet. The only negatives were the size of the lift - only marked for 4 people but barely took one person and luggage. Lighting in the room was not adequate for working.
reviews.title: Convenient, comfortable adequately appointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff, especially the daytime man, were friendly and efficient and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: nice hotel in geneva

reviews.text: As it is centrally located there are plenty of options for food and shops just a few steps away.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, would go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel in nice, clean and situated at great location.there is free breakfast. the staff was nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Nice stay but poor location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem is that there in no parking but if you came to visit Geneva you don't need a car
reviews.title: Not a bad option for a short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now then........I decided, being the bestest Boyfriend in the world to surprise my good lady with a two night break in Geneva by taking advantage of a British Airways Flight and Hotel Package via the internet. She wanted to see Switzerland in the Winter and that large water jet on Lake Geneva has always intrigued me. Not the cheapest Christmas Prezzie I have given to her, but I am of the opinion that she deserved it. (Gent's if you are looking to bolster the Smartie Point's Account, this idea seem's good)
reviews.title: Easier than an Easy Thing in Easy Land

reviews.text: The Strasbourg is one of the many hotels in the BA deals, and is possibly just about mid range for a short break. That old adage.........'it's somewhere to sleep so why have a posh room which you won't see anything of?' springs to mind. But even the most basic of rooms are good enough. You are in Geneva........get out and have look at it.
reviews.title: Friendly and helpful

reviews.text: The Strasbourg is a typical Swiss hotel. If you have never been in one, go and stay there. At least that way you will know whether it's for you or not. Personally, I see this establishment as a good B&B with obscenely good access to transport hubs. On a short break??? Then the Geneva transport, as has been mentioned so many times on here, is absolutely free!!!! The Hotel Staff will give you the travel vouchers when you check in. And I have to mention the staff.....they know exactly what they are doing and they speak very good English. So far so good then?
reviews.title: Great service, great location

reviews.text: There is a TV in the room, not brilliant signal/choice of viewing if you are that way inclined. Tea/Coffee making facilities if you request it from reception, did not bother ourselves. Bed, double, reasonably comfortable. Room warm. Bathroom, all you need to carry out your daily personal hygiene and purging. Electrical stuff, ask for an adapter at reception on check-in. It's a 10 Swiss Franc deposit, returnable on check-out. UK equipment runs OK on their voltage. Noise, walk and drink alcohol a lot, you'll never hear it when in deep slumber/alcohol induced coma. (Possibly different scenario in Summer with window open)
reviews.title: nice but...

reviews.text: The Strasbourg is conveniently located by the main railway station. Do not be in any way apprehensive about asking one of the many friendly locals which is the quickest walk from the station to the hotel. Just be wary of the trams outside the front of the station, they are very quiet obviously, and can bear down on you from out of nowhere. Talking of the trams et al.......how efficient/clean are they? Let's just say we Brits have a lot to learn about Public Transport from them. They even have handy information on the tram screens about the route and how to not fall foul of those elusive 'pick pockets' that we never encountered. But the warning is there none the less!
reviews.title: CONFORTABLE

description: Small Traditional Hotel located in the heart of the business district.
